sentences: Jacques Berman Webster II (born April 30, 1991), better known by his stage name Travis Scott (formerly stylized as Travi$ Scott), is an American rapper, singer, and record producer.
section: N/A

sentences: His stage name is the namesake of a favorite uncle combined with the first name of one of his inspirations, Kid Cudi (whose real name is Scott Mescudi).
section: N/A

sentences: In 2012, Scott signed his first major-label contract with Epic Records.
section: N/A

sentences: In November of the same year, Scott signed a publishing deal with Kanye West's GOOD Music, as part of its production wing Very GOOD Beats.
section: N/A

sentences: In April 2013, Scott signed a recording contract with T.I.'s Grand Hustle imprint.
section: N/A

sentences: Scott's first full-length project, the mixtape Owl Pharaoh, was self-released in 2013.
section: N/A

sentences: It was followed with a second mixtape, Days Before Rodeo, in August 2014.
section: N/A

sentences: His debut studio album, Rodeo (2015), was led by the hit single "Antidote".
section: N/A

sentences: His second album, Birds in the Trap Sing McKnight (2016), became his first number one album on the Billboard 200.
section: N/A

sentences: The following year, Scott released a collaborative album with Quavo titled Huncho Jack, Jack Huncho under the group name Huncho Jack.
section: N/A

sentences: In 2018, his third studio album, Astroworld, was released to critical acclaim and produced his first Billboard Hot 100 number one single, "Sicko Mode" (featuring Drake).
section: N/A

sentences: In late 2019, Scott's record label Cactus Jack Records released the compilation album JackBoys which became the first number one album on the Billboard 200 of the 2020s.
section: N/A

sentences: After the release of his single "Franchise" (featuring Young Thug and M.I.A.) in September 2020, Scott became the first artist on the Hot 100 to have three songs debut at number one in less than a year.
section: N/A

sentences: He has been nominated for eight Grammy Awards and won a Billboard Music Award and a Latin Grammy Award.
section: N/A

sentences: Scott has gained notoriety for controversies and legal issues regarding safety at his concerts.
section: N/A

sentences: On November 5, 2021, a mass-casualty crowd crush occurred during Scott's performance at the Astroworld Festival in his hometown of Houston, Texas, killing ten people and injuring hundreds of others.

== Early life ==

sentences: Early life ==
section: == Early life ==

sentences: Jacques Bermon Webster II was born on April 30, 1991, in Houston, Texas.
section: == Early life ==

sentences: From ages one through six, Webster lived with his grandmother in South Park, Houston.
section: == Early life ==

sentences: Located in south-central Houston, the neighborhood was notorious for crime and had an impact on a young Webster, "Growing up, my grandmother stayed in the 'hood
section: == Early life ==

sentences: so I seen random crazy shit.
section: == Early life ==

sentences: [I saw] mad bums and crazy spazzed out motherfuckers, I saw people looking weird, hungry, and grimey [sic].
section: == Early life ==

sentences: I was always like, 'I gotta get the fuck out this shit.'
section: == Early life ==

sentences: It gave me my edge—[it made me] who I am right now."
section: == Early life ==

sentences: Webster moved to Missouri City, a middle-class suburban area bordering southwest Houston, to live with his parents.
section: == Early life ==

sentences: His mother worked for Apple and his father ran his own business.
section: == Early life ==

sentences: Webster's father is also a soul musician and his grandfather was a jazz composer.
section: == Early life ==

sentences: Webster attended Elkins High School and graduated at seventeen.
section: == Early life ==

sentences: During high school, he participated in musical theater.
section: == Early life ==

sentences: Webster then attended the University of Texas at San Antonio, before dropping out his second year to fully pursue his music career.
section: == Early life ==

sentences: McDonald's ===
section: == Other ventures == | === McDonald's ===

sentences: In September 2020, Scott collaborated with McDonald's to launch a limited edition meal that was introduced in participating McDonald's restaurants in North America, named "The Travis Scott" and a variation on their Quarter Pounder with Cheese.

sentences: The partnership marked the first celebrity-endorsed McDonald's meal since McDonald's collaborated with Michael Jordan to launch a "McJordan" burger in 1992.
section: == Other ventures == | === McDonald's ===

sentences: Due to high demand, some McDonald's branches ran out of ingredients tied to the promotion, causing a break in the supply chain.
section: == Other ventures == | === McDonald's ===

sentences: Scott and McDonald's also launched a line of McDonald's and Cactus Jack–branded merchandise, including a number of clothing items, a rug, and a McNugget-shaped body pillow.

sentences: The idea was exported to Europe in the fall of 2021, with Spanish singer Aitana serving as the first European act to have its own McDonald's meal.

== Controversies and legal issues ==

sentences: Controversies and legal issues ==
section: == Controversies and legal issues ==
== Controversies and legal issues == | === Incidents at performances ===

sentences: Incidents at performances ===
section: == Controversies and legal issues == | === Incidents at performances ===

sentences: Scott's performances have experienced a number of issues.
section: == Controversies and legal issues == | === Incidents at performances ===

sentences: At Lollapalooza in 2015, Scott was charged and arrested for disorderly conduct after inciting concertgoers to ignore security and rush the stage.
section: == Controversies and legal issues == | === Incidents at performances ===

sentences: That same year, at the Openair Festival in Switzerland, he encouraged fans to attack a man who took his shoe while he was crowd-surfing, by stopping the concert and repeatedly telling the crowd to "fuck him up", while also spitting on him.
section: == Controversies and legal issues == | === Incidents at performances ===

sentences: In 2017, he was arrested for similar conduct to his Lollapalooza behavior after a performance in Northwest Arkansas.
section: == Controversies and legal issues == | === Incidents at performances ===

sentences: That same year, a fan sued Scott and the organizers of a 2017 concert at Terminal 5 in Manhattan after falling from a balcony and being dragged on stage, blaming the fall on a crowd surge.
section: == Controversies and legal issues == | === Incidents at performances ===

sentences: In 2019, three people were trampled and injured as a crowd rushed to enter the compound at Astroworld.
section: == Controversies and legal issues == | === Incidents at performances ===
== Controversies and legal issues == | === Astroworld Festival crowd crush ===

sentences: Astroworld Festival crowd crush =
section: == Controversies and legal issues == | === Astroworld Festival crowd crush ===
== Controversies and legal issues == | === Astroworld Festival crowd crush ===

sentences: On November 5, 2021, at least ten people died and hundreds were injured in a crowd crush moving toward the stage during Scott's performance at the Astroworld Festival in NRG Park in his hometown of Houston, Texas..
section: == Controversies and legal issues == | === Astroworld Festival crowd crush ===

sentences: On the first night, a crowd crush occurred, resulting in the deaths of at least nine people and the cancellation of the second night of the festival.
section: == Controversies and legal issues == | === Astroworld Festival crowd crush ===

sentences: In the aftermath of the crush, news outlets highlighted Scott's history of dangerous disregard for audience safety.
section: == Controversies and legal issues == | === Astroworld Festival crowd crush ===

sentences: Rolling Stone featured a statement from a fan who had been paralyzed during a 2017 show; The New York Times took note of Scott's 2015 guilty plea for reckless endangerment after he encouraged fans to climb security barricades; a Los Angeles Times article contained analysis by safety experts arguing that the deaths were preventable.
section: == Controversies and legal issues == | === Astroworld Festival crowd crush ===

sentences: Among other points of criticism was the fact that Scott halted his performance in 2015 when an audience member stole his shoe, ordering the crowd to beat up the person responsible.
section: == Controversies and legal issues == | === Astroworld Festival crowd crush ===

sentences: Shortly after, a lawsuit was announced by the concertgoers.
section: == Controversies and legal issues == | === Astroworld Festival crowd crush ===

sentences: It was started by Kristian Paredes, who filed for US$1,000,000 due to injuries he received.
section: == Controversies and legal issues == | === Astroworld Festival crowd crush ===
== Artistry ==

sentences: Artistry ==
section: == Artistry ==

sentences: Scott has stated that he is influenced by Bon Iver, Kid Cudi, M.I.A., Kanye West, Toro y Moi, Tame Impala, T.I., and Thom Yorke.
section: == Artistry ==

sentences: Spin magazine compared his 2013 mixtape Owl Pharaoh to Kid Cudi's Man on the Moon II: The Legend of Mr. Rager.
section: == Artistry ==

sentences: Scott makes heavy use of audio manipulation effects such as Auto-Tune, phasing, delays, and stereo-sculpted chorusing and harmony structures, predominantly influenced by producers Mike Dean and Alex Tumay.
section: == Artistry ==

sentences: Scott's musical style has been characterized as "ambient"; Scott himself has said "I'm not hip-hop".
section: == Artistry ==

sentences: Vulture described Scott's sound as "unremittingly dark, syncretic, hi-res, and above all unnatural".
section: == Artistry ==

sentences: Scott has said that he is a fan of Broadway theatre and would like to do an album of show tune covers.
section: == Artistry ==

sentences: He has said that he would like to write his own musical in the future.
section: == Artistry ==
